Healthcare Data Scientist  As a healthcare data scientist, your duties are to develop tools for collecting or extracting data maintained by hospitals, healthcare, providers, or federal and state agencies. You collect and analyze information, such as medical records, insurance claims, or billing information and then identify patterns or trends in the data and recommend ways to use that information to improve industry efficiency and performance. Healthcare data scientists develop forecasting and modeling programs designed to form analyses of medical records or other forms of healthcare information. Sometimes you use the models themselves while in other instances you develop these models so that healthcare workers can use them in their daily practices. Who are we looking for?  We're looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help lead the development of the quality of care and cost models that drive Amino's products. This is an exciting opportunity to use your expertise in model development and machine learning to use big data to directly help patients identify high quality, low cost care.  As a member of the Data Insights team, you will work with a cross-functional group of data scientists, engineers, and product managers to develop the models that power all of Amino's products. You will have the opportunity to dive deep into our broad set of health data to discover insights to improve our product offering as well as create new products. The Data Insights team is looking for a senior data scientist who is ready to share ideas, approaches, methodologies and tools to help Amino grow and thrive.  This role is a good fit for you if you:   Have experience working at a health tech company / startup   Have substantial knowledge in statistical methods and the application of machine learning   Are interested in working with massive healthcare datasets in a role with a high level of ownership and influence   Are looking for an opportunity to work in a mission-driven and innovative health tech company where you can develop additional data science and engineering skills   Value and practice collaboration and feedback. You ask questions and seek feedback on your own work and opinions   What you will do:   Use large, longitudinal datasets to develop models that will make it possible for users to navigate the healthcare system with ease and confidence   Build products that will improve healthcare accessibility and affordability   Work on interesting technical challenges and have the opportunity to apply a variety of data science approaches to improve the quality and accuracy of our models   Lead projects and share ideas and solutions derived from your individual skill set and knowledge   Collaborate with a team of data scientists and data engineers to develop models to identify the highest quality and most cost effective care   Develop innovative data products such as procedure cost comparisons, physician quality scores and a cost calculator   Skills and experience you possess:   5+ years work experience in data analytics / data science   Experience writing clean, well-tested code in SQL and Python   Expertise in statistical methods and predictive modeling   Experience developing and validating machine learning models and tools   Strong knowledge of and prior experience working with healthcare data   Strong documentation and verbal communication skills   Experience leading large data science projects, managing requirements across stakeholders to define the analytic approach and technical solutions   Good to have:   Advanced degree in computer science, engineering, data science or other relevant field   Experience in data engineering and large scale data processing frameworks   Experience working with healthcare claims data and data pipelines

location: 2113 Lewis Turner Blvd # 104, Fort Walton Beach, FL 32547
job_Description: We have an immediate opening for a Data Scientist/Statistical Analyst with emphasis on Experimental Design and Data Visualization in our Fort Walton Beach, Florida location. Job Details Candidate will be responsible for designing and directing analyses for a variety of simulation systems utilized by the Air Force Research Lab and other DoD organizations. Anyar's teams are multi-disciplinary and analysts will work closely with Software Developers, Engineers, and Scientists to translate high-level analysis objectives and requirements into actionable study plans. Candidate will use a variety of methods including parametric analysis, data visualization, and statistical modeling to understand and communicate complex outcomes and make recommendations for future analyses. Statement of Security Clearance This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a government-issued security clearance, pursuant to 32 CFR 117.10. Accordingly, all applicants must be United States citizens, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for security clearance. Responsibilities   Communicate with subject matter experts and study leads to translate high-level analysis objectives into actionable study plans.  Work with software/simulation developers to appropriately parameterize tools and scenarios for use with analysis techniques such as Design of Experiments (DOE), optimization, reinforcement learning, sensitivity analysis, and uncertainty quantification.  Design and implement post-processing and analysis of large, potentially unstructured datasets to aggregate, mine, and understand simulation results.  Compile and present reports which clearly communicate study outcomes to audiences of varying statistical and technical knowledge.  Basic Qualifications   M.S. in Statistical Computing, Data Science, Operations Research or similar  0 - 2 years of programming language experience  Ability to work with members of a team and independently  Strong communication skills with the ability to understand and articulate ideas both verbally and written  Anyar, Incorporated is an established Government Solutions provider headquartered in Fort Walton Beach, Florida, with a satellite office located in Raleigh, NC. Anyar, Inc. has a highly successful Research and Development (R&D) track record grounded in the DoD Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Program, which has expanded into several contracts with DoD customers in weapons development, systems-of-systems analysis, and testing task areas. We develop solutions for our customers in modeling and simulation, human injury prediction, mechanical explosive shock testing, Small Unmanned Aerial Systems support, and research through Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) contracts with federal agencies. We are an equal opportunity employer with health, dental, vision, life, disability, and 401k benefits available to our employees.

When you join Verizon  Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing...  The Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI&D) Organization is an exciting new center of excellence supporting all of Verizon, reporting into the Global Network & Technology team. Our team will be a catalyst to Verizon's future in creating networks that move the world forward through the power of Artificial Intelligence & Data. As a Data Insights and Strategy Analyst, you'll drive profitable growth and transform Customer Experience (CX) for 94M+ Verizon customers by leveraging the power of data, machine learning techniques and AI technology. You will be the catalyst enabling data science projects that drive industry leading customer experience. You will work closely with a team of talented data scientists, data engineers, and business leaders and play a key role in developing and delivering the next generation AI/ML solutions to the business. You’ll work with internal and external partners to create analytical models to predict the next best action on behalf of customers. You’ll then present the results to various business partners and sales operation executives. You will partner with business to build support for what-if analysis. Develop resolutions to complex problems, using your sharp judgment and evaluation criteria enables you to deliver solutions that make a big impact. Co-create the business problem and opportunity space by partnering with the business unit and responsible for shaping and drafting the AI/ML use cases. Shape ideas into business cases. Assess requirement and use case formulation. Develop strategies to fix the business problems and partner with stakeholders to design and implement changes. Design, develop, implement, and oversee high-end analytical, technology processes and solutions with a focus on leveraging advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence methods. Perform ad-hoc analysis and develop reproducible analytical approaches to meet business requirements. Perform exploratory and targeted data analyses using descriptive statistics and other methods. Present results and recommendations to senior management and business users. Communicate the business value of technical solutions. What we’re looking for...  You have empathy to understand customer pain points and you are obsessed with driving actionable insights to proactively resolve those pain points. You thrive in an environment where enormous volumes of data are generated at rapid speed. You’re a creative thinker who likes to explore, and tell stories using data. Communicating what you’ve uncovered in a way that can be easily understood by others is one of your strengths. You take pride in your ability to share your considerable knowledge with your peers. You’ll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Four or more years of relevant work experience. Experience with leading data analytics projects to improve consumer experience preferably in the telecom industry. Experience in leading large scale data science projects and delivering from end to end. Experience with data visualization tools(Tableau, Qlik). Strong technical experience in data wrangling and statistical modeling. Even better if you have: Experience in working in telesales operations. The ability to package analysis in clear and concise reports and presentations. Excellent communication skills. Strong foundational quantitative knowledge and skills; extensive training in math; statistics, engineering, or other related fields. Four or more years of experience in practicing machine learning and data science in business. Experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Experience in advanced machine learning algorithms – deep learning, boosting methods, time series etc. Experience in data management and data analysis in Teradata and in Hadoop. Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our  diversity and inclusion  page to learn more. The Senior Data Scientist – Cybersecurity is responsible for developing and organizing data-centered projects that ultimately inform and promote the company's expansion. With deep knowledge and expertise in applying machine learning to solve complex, real-world problems, the incumbent in this role formulates, recommends, and administers data-driven projects which are geared at furthering the company’s interests. He/She helps develop cutting edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) driven solutions based on a rich stream of clinical, claims, payer, and behavioral data. The Senior Data Scientist operates in a highly collaborative environment of data scientists, data engineers, domain experts and business leaders to deliver analytics products that have the potential to fundamentally alter how healthcare is thought about and delivered in a large scale.  We’re unique. You should be, too. We’re changing lives every day. For both our patients and our team members. Are you innovative and entrepreneurial minded? Is your work ethic and ambition off the charts? Do you inspire others with your kindness and joy? We’re different than most primary care providers. We’re rapidly expanding and we need great people to join our team. The Senior Data Scientist – Cybersecurity is responsible for developing and organizing data-centered projects that ultimately inform and promote the company's expansion. With deep knowledge and expertise in applying machine learning to solve complex, real-world problems, the incumbent in this role formulates, recommends, and administers data-driven projects which are geared at furthering the company’s interests. He/She helps develop cutting edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) driven solutions based on a rich stream of clinical, claims, payer, and behavioral data. The Senior Data Scientist operates in a highly collaborative environment of data scientists, data engineers, domain experts and business leaders to deliver analytics products that have the potential to fundamentally alter how healthcare is thought about and delivered in a large scale. Behaves as mentor to junior team members to provide technical advice. Collaborates with business partners to develop technical/business approaches and new or enhanced technical tools.  Interacts with internal and external peers and management to share highly complex information related to areas of expertise and/or to gain acceptance of new or enhanced technology/business solutions.  Identifies meaningful insights from “big data” sources. Assists in the coordination of various research initiatives. Support high visibility reporting operational area to driving change and device the development of dashboards using various visualization tools  Support the client in reporting on enterprise risks through the application of data science principles, tools, and methods and to share visualizations and dashboards to drive remediation, mitigation, and risk management activities  Ability to create database categories for raw data population  Turn unstructured data into data ready for analysis  Develop automation with data analysis tools and create customized searches and applications using programming and development expertise, including Java, Python, shell scripting, and regular expression  Create and optimize Big Data correlations as a Splunk search language (SPL) expert  Develop and apply algorithms to unstructured data to uncover new sights. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:  Keen business acumen and acuity  Strong knowledge and understanding of machine learning fundamentals including classical machine learning and deep learning techniques  Excellent verbal communication skills, including the ability to articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences  Superb interpersonal, organization, time-management, OVERVIEW  777 Partners is a Miami-based investment firm focused on a broad spectrum of financial services businesses across insurance, lending, specialty finance, and financial technology. Operating in attractive markets and often times esoteric asset classes, 777 seeks to make control investments across the business life cycle in companies with scalable profiles and ambitious management teams. For more information on 777 Partners, visit www.777part.com.  JOB SUMMARY  The Senior Data Scientist is an opportunity for an experienced data scientist to apply advanced modeling skills to support the rapid growing analytic functionality for all 777 Partner businesses. This role requires strong sense in data, statistics, modeling, development, and performance governance. Strong communication skill is also required to receive key business needs from and deliver modeling insights back to business owners.  Honesty, integrity and work ethic are at the core of our team's culture. The successful candidate will be confident and inquisitive. Additionally, the successful candidate will have a familiarity and comfort being an independent contributor: evaluating, analyzing and modeling hazard and economic risks for our portfolios. Data scientists on this team specialize in an industry, but actively share best practices.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Assist Real Estate stakeholders to develop and maintain and machine learning solutions and reporting solutions offering users drill through capabilities  Extending company's data with third-party real-estate resources when needed  Selecting housing and environmental features, building and optimizing models using machine learning techniques  Collaborate with data and software engineering team in creating automated model governance and performance verification processes  Understand model limitations and propose and justify possible improvement  Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner  Provide mentorship to junior data scientists in aspects of machine learning, data and software engineering, and assist them with practical guidance, when needed   SKILLS / KNOWLEDGE / ABILITIES   Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques, feature engineering, and algorithms with ability to learn new techniques and algorithms quickly  Experience with systems-level data science toolkits (scikit-learn, R, Spark, or ElasticSearch)  Experience with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, Keras, or PyTorch)  Experience with data visualization tools (Kibana, ggplot, matplotlib)  Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL  Mastery of applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.  Familiar with version control systems (Git, GitHub, Bitbucket)  Familiar with Agile Development, or CI/CD  Great communication skills  Capacity to foster a healthy, stimulating work environment that frequently harnesses teamwork   EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE   Master's or Bachelor's in Quantitative Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, or Industrial Engineering preferred; can be offset with 5+ years of relevant experience in Data Science or other quantitative field  5+ years of experience in a data science capacity   PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms. The employee is rarely required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.  The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.  EEOC  777 Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All aspects of consideration for employment and employment with the Company are governed on the bases of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

job_title: Endowed Professorship (Open Rank), Statistics and Data Science
job_Description: Job no:  500766  Work type:  Faculty  Location:  Main Campus (Orlando)  Categories:  Sciences   Classification Title:  Endowed Professorship (Open Rank), Statistics and Data Science   Administrative Title:  No Administrative Function   Job Description:  The Department of Statistics and Data Science at the University of Central Florida (UCF) invites applications for a 9-month, tenure-track or tenured endowed professorship position (open rank), anticipated to begin August 2022. The position will carry a rank commensurate with the candidate’s demonstrated record of teaching, research and service.   We seek faculty candidates with a background in statistical learning, artificial intelligence, or machine learning. The successful applicant must have a strong record in research that is commensurate with a tenure-track or tenured position in the Department of Statistics and Data Science at UCF.   Furthermore, the ideal candidate will be an excellent mentor who can help students master both the theoretical and practical skills needed for success in this highly interdisciplinary field. We are especially interested in an individual who can lead the effort to build a nationally recognized big data research program. The selected candidate should also contribute through their research, teaching, and service to the diversity and excellence of our academic community to foster an environment in which faculty, staff, and students from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and personal experiences are welcomed and can thrive.   The Department of Statistics and Data Science at UCF is dedicated to high-caliber research at the intersection of statistics, statistical machine learning, deep learning, data mining, computer science, and applied mathematics, and to developing the statistical and analytical abilities of students that are necessary in an increasingly data-driven world. The Ph.D. program in Big Data Analytics offered by the department is the first of its kind in Florida, and one of only a few programs globally, that trains students and researchers to tackle the scale and complexity of real-world datasets encountered in contemporary industrial and academic settings. In addition to the Ph.D. in Big Data Analytics, the department offers two undergraduate degrees, one in Statistics and one in Actuarial Science; an M.S. degree with two tracks in Data Science and Statistics, and an SAS Data Mining Certificate program. In 2021, the department is expected to launch a joint B.S. degree program in Data Science between the College of Sciences (COS) and the College of Engineering and Computer Science (CECS). For more information, visit https://sciences.ucf.edu/statistics/.   The College of Sciences houses most of the university’s natural, computational, and social sciences in eight departments, two schools, and several centers. The college’s programs play a key role in advancing UCF as a national research university that is determined to help students from all backgrounds achieve success. For more information, visit https://sciences.ucf.edu/.   UCF, located in Orlando, Florida, is classified as a Very High Research Activity university by the Carnegie Foundation. With a diverse student body of more than 72,000 students, UCF is one of the largest universities in the country. The university offers more than 200-degree programs. UCF is committed to diversity and is designated as a Hispanic Serving Institution. For more information, visit http://www.ucf.edu.   Department:  AA-College of Sciences, Department of Statistics and Data Science   Type of Appointment:  Regular   Advertised Annual Salary:  Negotiable   Minimum Qualifications:  A doctorate in Statistics, Data Science, or a closely related field from an accredited institution is required.   In order to obtain tenure, the selected candidate must have a demonstrated record of teaching, research and service commensurate with rank.   Preferred Qualifications:  Preference will be given to candidates who have a strong record of funding, extensive experience in mentoring/supervising Ph.D. students, and have made outstanding contributions in the areas of data science, big data analytics, statistics, high-dimensional data analysis, machine learning, and/or deep learning and have a willingness to teach courses in these areas.   Special Instructions to Applicants:   Additional Application Materials Required:  UCF requires all applications and supporting documents to be submitted electronically through the Human Resources website, https://www.ucf.edu/jobs/. In addition to the online application, interested candidates should upload the following: a CV, a letter of interest, and statements of research and teaching. Additionally, applicants must provide the names and contact information for three professional references.   NOTE: Please have all application documents ready when applying so they can be attached at that time. Once the online submission process is finalized, the system does not allow applicants to submit additional documents at a later date.   Review of applications will begin September 1, 2021 and continue until the position is filled.   Questions regarding the position should be directed to Edgard Maboudou, Search Committee Chair, at edgard.maboudou@ucf.edu.   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:  As an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, UCF encourages all qualified applicants to apply, including women, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and members of traditionally underrepresented populations. UCF's Equal Opportunity Statement can be viewed at: http://www.oie.ucf.edu/documents/PresidentsStatement.pdf. As a Florida public university, UCF makes all application materials and selection procedures available to the public upon request.  The University of Central Florida is proud to be a smoke-free campus and an E-Verify employer.    Advertised:  July 16, 2021 Eastern Daylight Time  Applications close:

In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels. Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater and the Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end-to-end.  We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like ML and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.  The Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale. We are seeking to transform the way brands interact with their customers and elevate the human experience.  Come join a team of passionate, talented "pure" data scientists and hybrid ML engineers who collaborate to design, build and maintain cutting-edge ML solutions that arm our clients with real-time customer insights delivering tremendous value. If you ' re intellectually curious, hardworking and solution-oriented, you ' ll fit right into our fast-paced, collaborative environment.       Work you   '  ll do   As an ML Engineer ,  you ' ll support the development and deployment of transformational ML capabilities for large clients. You ' ll combine leading open source tooling and techniques with a suite of customer experience libraries and solutions, which automate the management of cross-channel communications with consumers for large clients. We make heavy use of the Python machine learning ecosystem, and build systems to deliver massive decisioning throughput, with tight latency constraints on our real-time systems. If you have deep experience in designing, implementing, automating and deploying machine learning pipelines and workflows, we want to hear from you!  Your responsibilities will include:    Participate in all phases of the model development lifecycle Solution productionalized machine learning to drastically reduce total cost per decision, moving expensive human-driven decisions to drastically cheaper and more effective machine-driven ones Help design and implement functional requirements for client engagements Collaborate with our services data scientists to deploy and use libraries and APIs which make machine learning for customer use cases both easy and powerful, and help brands gain deep understandings of their consumers Prepare technical documentation Integrate with surrounding technology components and services Coach junior team members   Successful skillsets for this role are:    Deep interest in data science and software development Eager to work with data scientists, fellow engineers and product owners Experienced with collaborative techniques like pair-programming and white board design sessions Continuously learning and improving, and constantly exploring new languages, tools, and techniques    The team   Advertising, Marketing & Commerce  Our Advertising, Marketing & Commerce team focuses on delivering marketing and growth objectives aligned with our clients' brand values for measurable business growth. We do this by creating content, communications, and experiences that engage and inspire their customers to act. We implement and operate the technology platforms that enable personalized content, commerce and marketing user-centric experiences. In doing so, we transform our clients' marketing and engagement operations into modern, data-driven, creatively focused organizations. Our team brings deep experience in creative and digital marketing capabilities, many from our Digital Studios.  We serve our clients through the following types of work:    Cross-channel customer engagement strategy, design and development (web, mobile, social, physical) eCommerce strategy, implementation and operations Marketing Content and digital asset management solutions Marketing Technology and Advertising Technology solutions Marketing analytics implementation and operations Advertising campaign ideation, development and execution Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development and execution Agile based, design-thinking, user-centric, empirical projects that accelerate results    Qualifications  Required    3+ years of experience authoring, supporting or providing a data science platform to data scientists: Deep knowledge in the machine learning lifecycle, and in ways to facilitate collaboration and productivity in each of its phases. Exposure to a number of data scientists and expertise in finding solutions to workflow problems. Knowledge of common machine learning frameworks and libraries and in ways to productionalize their inputs and outputs Comfort with various machine learning techniques and their practical implementation, particularly reinforcement learning Experience with one or more common workflow / pipelining frameworks (Kubeflow, MLFlow, Argo or equivalents) Strong knowledge of the Python ecosystem, the Jupyter ecosystem (Lab, Notebook, Binder) and their libraries, norms and tooling Exposure to AutoML tooling (H2O, DataRobot or equivalents) Experience in deploying and maintaining enterprise-scale machine learning applications in production 2+ years of experience writing well-tested production software 1+ years of experience on distributed, high throughput and low latency architecture. 1+ years of experience building software on top of major container technology (Kubernetes, docker, or similar). Strong testing mindset with experience writing tests at various levels of granularity Familiarity with Continuous Integration tools (GitHub actions, Travis-CI, etc.) A history of good collaboration with DevOps and Project Managers on meeting project goals. Proven track record working with products from major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.   Preferred:    Experience with large consumer data sets used in performance marketing is a major advantage Exposure and/or expertise writing and/or running Terraform or other infrastructure-as-code automation Well-versed in (or contributes to) data-centric open source projects Experience in performance analysis and optimization of machine learning applications, e.g. in optimizing code written by others Presence or contributions to projects within the wider open source ecosystem Proven ability to communicate both verbally and in writing within a high performance, collaborative environment. Exposure to commonly used relational and non-relational databases   AMC2021

The  Lead Data Scientist  will manage multiple data science projects including but not limited to assessing business needs, research, identifying data science opportunities, designing, developing innovative methodologies, data modeling, evaluating and execution to solve complex business problems in alignment with organizational goals and objectives using independent judgement. You will lead data scientist whowill also integrate with cross functional teams and manage stakeholders. As the Lead Data scientists you will be a technical leader who is able to bring in new technologies and implement across organization. You will be responsible for advising and mentoring junior data scientists and analysts.   Essential Functions  Lead multiple concurrent projects and accommodate frequent interruptions and changing priorities and ability to make independent decisions  Partner with cross functional teams to assess complex business needs and design business experiments by understanding the organizational goals and objectives  Communicate actionable insights and integrate multiple analytical projects to solve business problems in an efficient manner and understand the effectiveness of interventions  Proactively identify and communicate roadblocks. Evaluate and suggest alternatives to overcome.  Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts, data engineers and visualization developers on analytical projects to complete the data science life cycle in a successful manner  Implementation of new data science technologies across the enterprise  Effectively lead meetings with customers and guide discussion and decision making.  Identify, define and translate complex business needs/problems into analytical questions by working directly with cross functional business partners along with project scope and project management.  Design and execute advanced machine learning experiments, models, algorithms, and visualizations independently understand data sources and limitations, warehousing system and the impact of the data on business decisions and propose new data sources that can be utilized for advanced analytics based on research  Identify, retrieve, and manipulate structured and unstructured data from internal and external datasets  Apply advanced and innovative statistical and computational methodologies to provide actionable insights and identify strategic opportunities that optimize quality, consumer experience, and healthcare costs.  Develop scalable, efficient, and automated processes for large scale data analyses and model development, validation, and implementation.  Implement business feedback loop into the developed models and also develop automated process to evaluate models performance from time to time  Write technical reports, white papers, and publications.  Stay current on new processes and technology in Data Science and provide findings on advanced analytical and computational methodologies to other Data Scientists and analysts.  Responsible for developing talent and effectively leading small teams.   Required Skills:  7+ years related work experience in a Data Scientist or similar role  Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer science (e.g. specialization: Machine learning/Artificial Intelligence /Visualization, databases, and Big Data), Statistics, Epidemiology, Health Services Research, or closely related field with Data Science specialization  Requires experience with statistical packages – 4-7 years of SAS /R/Python, SAS EG, and SAS EM. Also requires experience in SQL, Tableau/any visiualization tool (Power BI).  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Strong willingness and emerging ability to lead projects and manage project phases or smaller projects in their entirety (includes project management).  Ability to partner with customers across the organization to assess needs and define business questions. Influencing customers to take action on analytical insights.  Ability to communicate results and insights, both verbally and written (including visual graphics), in a clear and concise manner to a non-technical audience.  Must have applied experience with advanced statistics e.g. predictive analytics models  Must have applied experience in Machine Learning  Must have experience in Visual analytics  Experience with large data sets  Excel/PowerPoint skills (including visual graphics)  Must have experience working with other teams - IT, product, data warehousing etc  Must have strong teamwork and collaborative skills  Ability to prioritize work, independently  Ability to prioritize projects and resource planning  Proven ability to meet and exceed deadlines  Strong decision making ability  Ability to influence decision makers  Clear proven track record of creating strong actionable insights that drive decision making and business process  Strong written and oral communication skills  Experience interacting with, and presenting to, customers  Experience managing projects from end-to-end, including project plan development   Preferred Skills:  Master’s degree Applied Mathematics, Computer science (e.g. specialization: Machine learning/Artificial Intelligence /Visualization, databases, and Big Data), Statistics, Epidemiology, Health Services Research, or closely related field with Data Science specialization  Experience in Big Data - e.g. Hadoop  Experience with other tools –e.g. Tableau, R, and Netezza  Business Intelligence tool development  Other programming experience - Java, Perl, Python, UNIX/Linux scripting  Healthcare, medical, or pharmaceutical work experience  Experience with analysis around quality, consumer experience, and healthcare costs  SAS certification  Experience in consumer analytics  Experience in advanced business analytics   General Physical Demands  Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects.  Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally. At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success. As a senior/lead Data Analyst, you will not only work closely with different stakeholders like Growth team, Game team and Business Development team to help inform decision making through analysis and dashboarding, but also be jack-of-all-trade when it comes to provide data solution, improve internal process,assess 3rd-party data services and mentor junior team members.  Tilting Point offers a wide variety of benefits and perks including medical/dental/vision coverage, 401k with employer match, wellness stipends, unlimited PTO, inclusive and fully paid parental leave and much more!  Your Future at Tilting Point   Draw meaningful conclusions and provide actionable insights from data to shape and influence in-game features, economies, and future product roadmaps; Offer guidance and recommendations on in-game event tracking design and A/B testing.  Identify areas of opportunity for optimizing ad monetization yield and user acquisition ROAS performance, leveraging MMP data; Help maintain LTV forecast models.  Design data workflows that help build informative and easy-to-use dashboards, powered by scalable and efficient backend logic; Provide other data exploration solutions as needed.  Present analytical findings as both written communication and visual representations that are clear, concise and understandable, to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Build relationships with stakeholders and processes around data deliverables to ensure data driven decisions can be made at all levels across Tilting Point.  Collaborate with partner teams to define areas of opportunity and set priorities; Work with management to plan the roadmap and drive initiatives.  Design and evaluate data process, practice and solution to advance Tilting Point's analytics capability.   Your XP & Skills   University degree (BA or BS) in Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field. Advanced degree strongly preferred.  5+ years of work experience as a data analyst or scientist, supporting consumer-facing products and digital marketing; mobile app/game preferred.  Highly proficient with SQL. Familiarity with Python, PySpark and/or Amplitude is a plus.  Expert in building interactive data toolings/dashboards. Experienced with Tableau and/or Looker.  Passionate about mobile/social gaming with a good understanding of the market.  Comfortable working with local and remote teams with different time zones and cultures.

We are looking for an incredible  Senior Data Scientist  to join our product innovation team in Miami.  hear.com  is the fastest-growing hearing care company globally. We are driven by our belief that every person should hear well to live well. With our unique digital business model, we have changed the way hearing care is provided. We are a profitable global health-technology company with origins in Europe. Since starting our journey in 2012, we have helped over 200,000 customers get on the path to better hearing. In just 9 years, we have grown our team from 2 to over 1,500 people. We work hard and play hard in 11 international locations from Miami to Seoul.  The role:  Build and implement data science strategies to optimize our sales and marketing funnel Model algorithms to predict auction prices in ad auctions  Design and implement complex data models for our Customer Data Platform  Design, build and automate new work flows via introduction of ML + cloud based products  Ownership of engineering and data modeling process  Drive best practice across the data engineering function   About you:   Bachelors or Masters in Statistics, Applied Mathematics or similar OR equivalent work experience  Expertise in data engineering, data modelling and virtualization  Comfortable programming in Python and Matlab  Advanced knowledge of SQL  Familiar with modern optimization methods including lasso regularization and convex optimization  Experience importing and analyzing Facebook and Google Ads  Familiarity with database technologies (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, MySQL) and AWS  Experience in BI tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Power BI)  Experience in at least one workflow management platform (Airflow, Meltano, PipelineWise, Talend etc)  Excellent communication and problem solving skills  Experience in distributed computing is a plus (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Pulsar, AWS Kinesis)   Why hear.com:   Change lives… see the real world impact of what you do (this is the best part) !!  A chance to shape the future of a leading HealthTech  A unique content-driven, top-performing and family-type work culture  A high degree of autonomy and responsibility from day one  An open-minded and international working environment that fosters creativity  Excellent salary and benefits package with entrepreneurial incentives  Option to work remotely   If you want to be part of a dynamic and rapid growth company,  apply now ... a new challenge awaits you!

From applied AI to optimization to big data platform engineering, your analytical and technical skills will drive real impact in the business world. At KPMG, our commitment to your career development helps to set us apart as an employer. We want to enhance your potential, both for yourself and as a contributor to our firm. rapidly iterate models and results to refine and validate approach Assist clients on model development and validation efforts, such as regulatory requirements (e.g. CCAR/DFAST, CECL, Initial Margin, etc.) and economic risk (e.g. PG/LGD, mortgage prepayment, pricing, xVA, customer segmentation, credit scorecard, etc.) Deliver on engagement milestones by following analytics processes to mitigate risks in data, modeling, validation, and delivery; Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover interesting trends and relationships Qualifications: Minimum of two years of experience working in teams of data & analytics professionals to deliver on business-driven analytics projects using statistical modeling, econometrics, and machine learning; Excellent problem-solving skills, verbal/written communication, and ability to explain technical concepts to business audience A Master’s or PhD degree from an accredited college/university in Statistics, Econometrics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Quantitative Finance, or related fields Ability to apply artificial intelligence techniques to achieve concrete business goals while working with the business to understand available resources and constraints around data (sources, integrity, and definitions), processing platforms, and security; job_title: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Scientist
job_Description: Job Description: Dewberry  is currently seeking a  Computer Vision and Machine Learning Scientist  for its  Fairfax, VA  office. Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets contained within massive geospatial data sets? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by advances in machine learning and artificial intelligence? In an increasingly interconnected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities for innovation. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to help deliver on national-level challenges. We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to improve Dewberry’s advanced geospatial offerings. You’ll work closely with a dedicated internal research and development (IRAD) team to help advance: Insights from massive data regimes across an emergency management customer domain to help drive actionable understanding that powers better decision making. New process improvements for how Dewberry geospatial production teams produce and deliver large scale/high quality geospatial data. Assist other Dewberry business units and their customers to better understand complex engineering and data challenges and then deliver best-fit analytical workflows or “GeoAI” solutions that leverage modern compute vision frameworks. Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century. You’ll mentor teammates, develop algorithms, write scripts, build predictive analytics, use automation, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn disparate geospatial data points into answers that propel Dewberry’s business enterprise.  Help Dewberry empower innovation that compliments and extends our already award-winning Geospatial Technology & Services (GTS) team.  Required Skills & Required Experience: Minimum of 3 years work experience with relevant GIS, AI, DL, and ML design and build experience Experience in the lifecycle of enterprise-class software development Experience in Machine Learning technologies Team leadership skills Strong Python programming skills Experience conducting machine learning/statistical experiments and manipulating data sets Understanding and experience of machine learning, and deep learning theory, algorithms, approaches and practice, including probabilistic and statistical learning, graphical models, machine perception, machine comprehension, neural networks, deep learning, computer vision and other machine learning areas Hands on and strong programming experience in one or more of the leading AI, machine learning and deep learning open source libraries Proficiency with computer vision, natural language processing and deep learning Understanding of machine learning algorithms and principles Expertise and experience in using or developing AI and machine learning algorithms, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning and others, to solve applied problems in various disciplines Experience developing, training, and evaluating deep-learning models using deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Keras) Experience with open source vision packages Familiarity with CUDA and GPU computing Strong proficiency with Python BS, MA, or MS in a quantitative science: Computer Science, Math, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or relevant program with major in AI, Machine Learning, or Computational Linguistics Experience with generating technical reports or presentation materials for both technical and non-technical audiences Experience with integrating commercial software tools and APIs for custom application development Experience applying AI/ML approaches and workflows on large quantities of geospatial data sets to derive new insights at scale (i.e. Orthophotography, LIDAR) Experience with reading, digesting, and writing scientific papers Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills Active security clearance a plus Must have a valid driver’s license, good driving record and ability to pass a driving record background check.  In accordance with applicable Executive Order 14042 and related requirements, all prospective hires for this position, performing work for the federal government, will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19, or qualify for an exemption to this vaccination requirement. Such proof of vaccination, or written request for exemption, will be required, following receipt of written offer. At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization. Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Only recipients of an offer of employment from Dewberry, will be required to submit to a background screening which may include, but is not limited to, employment verification, educational and other credential verification, driving record check, criminal background check, and an investigative consumer report. These screenings will be conducted by Dewberry’s background vendor of choice and will be conducted in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local law.

Location: Melbourne, United States of America Thales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world’s largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference. When you rely on airlines to connect you in flight, you rely on Thales. In an increasingly fast paced world, we make the unpredictable, predictable by connecting and entertain passengers to make your life better. Combining a diversity of talents, we master the decisive moments that matter to passengers and airlines. Whatever it takes. Job Summary As a Principal Data Scientist, you will analyze product, quality of experience and business problems using analytics. You must demonstrate critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving abilities, hands-on intelligence led data analysis skills, and network analysis acumen. You will be an individual contributor in a high visibility role, positioning you to deliver high impact at Thales Inflyt Experience Digital engineering team and challenging you with learning opportunities that will help you grow and accelerate your career. You should have experimentation, metric & data creation, and data visualization skills as well as excellent communication skills to interface between technical, product and operations teams. Essential Functions / Key Areas of Responsibility Principal Data Scientist, to lead a team of data engineers, and front-end software engineers to conduct advanced analytics and problem-solving abilities on big data.  · Conduct analysis of large datasets and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that will provide insight on our product services performances.  Define metrics, build and utilize dashboards, self-service tools to help measure and report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).  Develop and leverage innovative features and algorithms to drive down false positives and conduct data mining / query functions across relational or big data databases utilizing various data science tools and methods. job_Description: The Talent Acquisition Operations Reporting and Data Analyst will lead the efforts to create a more robust reporting and analytics function within the organization to include creating standard global reports to consistently track metrics and performance of key operational processes. job_title: Business and Data Analyst, Senior Vice Present
job_Description: Advance Data Analytics and Services (ADA) Team is a group within Risk Modeling and Analytics (RMA) Organization, responsible for developing libraries, models, and applications centered around the in-house big data platform. The team works closely with Risk technology and the RMA analytical model teams to leverage big-data modelling and solutions to complement the core modelling work. The team applies expertise across data management, cloud architecture and risk analytics to streamline the risk management processes. The initial scope of the work is on FRTB, providing tools and solutions to facilitate validation by model sponsors, reporting, understanding, and what-if analysis. The scope will then be extended across all product areas including RWA, CCAR, CECL/IFRS9. We are seeking a Business and Data Analyst at Senior VP level to lead the effort on: Leverages big data to develop innovative deployable solutions. Work closely with core infrastructure and model developers to design and develop visualization tools and analytical services Provide insights and supports to business users on the use of model and explains. Work closely with risk managers to translate business needs to technical specifications. Partners with Risk and Decision Management organizations to understand the source of new data and continue to improve the process of defining, extracting and utilizing the new data Communicate in a professional, effective and concise manner with high level executives and varied stakeholders. Provide leadership and guidance for junior modelers. Our ideal candidate is a highly competent risk professional with 10 years of experience in building complex reporting solution involving a cross section of models: Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree Experience with risk management and key financial and operational metrics used in valuation of risk and capital, analytics decomposition and aggregation. Experience with enterprise-level reporting and analytics using BI tools such as Tableau for visualization design, metrics, risk decomposition etc. Good familiarity with emerging technologies, including: Hadoop, Spark, large scale data frameworks, machine learning. Good understanding of various modeling approach on asset returns and correlation, coherent risk measures, Monte Carlo, historical simulation, stress testing, tail risk of an investment portfolio, market and credit risk Ability to deliver compelling presentations and influence executive audiences. The Senior Strategic Data Analyst is responsible for the promotion and enablement of a data-driven culture within Healthfirst Operations. Company Description Money Mart Financial Services is a leading provider of financial services in North America. For 40 years, we have been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of consumers and business owners. Backed by a retail network of over 700 locations and robust digital and mobile platforms, we provide access to cash and related products to help our customers achieve their goals. Our highly skilled workforce puts customers first in everything we do. We serve 2 million people annually with diverse and innovative financial products such as loans, check cashing, money transfer and prepaid cards. Through this ever-evolving suite of services, we empower customers to manage their finances and improve their lives. Wherever customers are on their financial journey, Money Mart Financial Services provides solutions. Job Description The AI/ML team is a newly formed team at Moneymart. The team is diverse, passionate and on a mission to build state of the art Artificial Intelligence(AI) and Machin Learning(ML) models that support all facets of the growing digital and retail business. We are just getting started on building a Machine Learning platform as well as customer 360 profile with modern technology so this is a huge opportunity to shape the future vision of the company. If you are looking for a growth opportunity and working with talented individuals come join us! We value collaboration, take ownership mindset and the importance of thinking like an engineer with the curiosity of a scientist. As a Credit Risk Scientist you will play a huge role not only with building models across our lending, portfolio but also be involved in deploying and monitoring of the models in production. What you will do : Responsible for developing and implementing our credit underwriting models Use machine learning (ML) to build credit underwriting models leveraging alternate and traditional data sets Use ML to segment our customers based on behavior and propensity to engage with our various lending products Recommend optimal segmentation strategy to build different models for different consumer segments Work on a modern AI/ML platform Use every dataset at disposal to build a feature store for AI/ML models as well as a customer 360 profile Set up testing infrastructure to test different underwriting and credit strategies for different lending products Conceive, design & monitor risk management strategies to improve business profitability in the areas of underwriting, credit line management, universe expansion and alternative data evaluation for lending. Qualifications 5+ years consumer credit risk experience including building credit scorecards/scoring systems Hands on experience building credit underwriting models and feature engineering Familiarity with bureau data and alternate data is a strong requirement Strong development experience with Python is a must along with ML libraries (pandas, numpy, scikit learn, tensorflow) Familiarity with H2O, Azure ML and Amazon Services is a plus but not required Experience in SQL Ability to thrive in in a fast paced, team oriented environment Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering Additional Information We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. I'm interested Cookies Settings

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer. Location : USA - Remote We are seeking a Sr. Data Science Product Manager to join the Life Science Solutions Group (LSG) Data Science team. As our team grows, we are seeking individuals who want to join the fast growing data science field. The Sr. Data Science Product Managers on the team are trusted data science leaders that help our division business partners achieve their strategy by using our data science capabilities with the ultimate goal of being leaders in digital science. The Sr. Data Science Product Manager works collaboratively with data scientists to build and deploy solutions that support our divisional partner goals. Discover Impactful Work: The Sr. Data Science Product Manager practices strategic analysis to understand the business challenges and translates those into solutions for our customers. They work as a data science consultant, developing solutions that address business challenges and opportunities across the Life Sciences Group. They develop data science capabilities that scale across teams, regions, and functions. The Sr. Data Science Product Manager partners with sales and marketing leadership to align, develop and deliver complex data science solutions in an agile development environment. They operate in a matrix organization, often without authority, to both establish data science strategic direction for the division and implement projects that achieve the data science goals. The Sr. Data Science Product Manager works in an inclusive environment where continual improvement and learning are part of the process. They are proficient as a product owner and passionate about increasing business value and product backlog optimization. You recommend and apply best-practices leveraging insights from other data science initiatives across Thermo Fisher Scientific. Responsibilities Manages cross-divisional strategic initiatives with significant impact across functions or divisions Collaborates with the business to understand business problems and strategic direction Influences and leads across organizational boundaries to deliver cross-functional, complex initiatives Defines a vision and translates requirements into capabilities that partners want and will use Designs and delivers data science solutions that can scale across teams and functions Expands scope of impact by leveraging the capabilities of others Keys to Success: Education Bachelor's degree required Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Analytics/Data Science preferred Experience 8+ years experience in data product management, program management, analytics or consulting required Life Sciences experience required Certified Scrum Product Ownership (CSPO) certification preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Proven ability to develop, align and deliver data science solutions in the face of uncertainty Effective at setting a strategic vision and works with leadership to align on direction Intellectually curious; Asks the right questions for a deeper understanding Effective data science product leader with experience increasing business value Influences across organizational boundaries to deliver cross-functional, complex initiatives Builds constructive and effective relationships with relevant partners Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000 colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.  Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. Do you love the art of using data to solve complex business problems? We do too – and would be excited to have you join our team at Walt Disney World!  Our mission as part of the Commercial Strategy organization is to put our data assets to work, and apply quantitative techniques to discover previously unknown insights about our Guests and business. We get to work directly with the major decision-makers at Disney who shape the Walt Disney World experience. Through our insights, we help form and improve Disney products and offerings.  This is a unique role, in that it looks across a variety of functional areas, and enables the creation of holistic models to better predict and prescribe improvements to the overall Walt Disney World business. A position like this puts you in the middle of the main commercial decisions of the company – and is a great way to showcase your data science skills!  The Senior Analyst – Data Science currently reports to the Lead Data Science and is an individual contributor role.   Responsibilities : While each day will be different, with rotating priorities, the main themes for this role include you being a(n):  Data Wrangler: You understand data and how it supports solving business problems. You will translate the business and analytic needs into data requirements to ensure you have the information you need to solve the problem, and work with technology partners to troubleshoot data quality You will work in a large, complex data environment, compiling and cleansing data across a variety of domains to create a foundation for your analytic work.  Analytics Creator: You leverage data science skills to deliver mathematical models and adhoc statistical analyses. You will conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data collection and exploration, feature generation and reduction, and algorithm selection. You will determine the best techniques to use to solve problems efficiently and effectively, examining all aspects of the analytics curve across statistical, predictive, and prescriptive methods.  Insights Translator: You interpret outputs of analyses and models to make relevant recommendations. You will draw inferences, quantify uncertainty/risk, and identify limitations to accurately summarize your findings, relating them back to the problem at hand. You will successfully craft key takeaways and next steps in the context of business actionability, while facilitating the integration of your work into the decision making process.  Basic Qualifications :  3-5 years of experience in a technical role (analytics, mathematics, software engineering) Knowledge of data science/advanced analytic concepts Experience developing presentations and reports using quantitative information for non-technical stakeholders Proficiency in at least one programming language such as R or Python Advanced knowledge of relational databases and SQL programming Knowledge of industry leading data and analytic tools (e.g., Snowflake, Git, Sagemaker, Dataiku, Tableau) Time-management skills, with ability to prioritize multiple requests and communicate status to partners/leadership  Required Education :  Required Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, econometrics)    Preferred Education :  Preference for a Masters

job_title: Principal IS Architect - Conversational AI/Automation - Remote Location
job_Description: Career Category Information Systems Job Description HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Principal Information Systems (IS) Product Architect - Conversational Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Automation Live What you will do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be responsible for architecting, designing, and implementing Conversational AI related solutions. The role will provide leadership for the successful delivery of key initiatives in partnership with functional IS teams for EEA services and will be responsible for developing and managing the technology roadmap for various Conversational AI, Search and Natural Language Processing (NLP) related platforms. As a Principal Information Systems (IS) Product Architect you will: Analyze and measure the effectiveness of existing technologies and tools related to Conversational AI and NLP and provides input to develop sustainable, repeatable and quantifiable improvements. Has broad experience with deploying AI solutions to production on a DevOps-focused team. Lead the technical design, development, testing, implementation, and support of key projects implementing Conversational AI related solutions. Define architecture and technical road maps for Conversational AI platforms. Understand business requirements, information and systems translating them to solutions. Research and evaluate technical solutions including various open source and proprietary Conversational AI and NLP related platforms and tools. Advice and support project teams (project managers, architects, business analysts, and developers) on tools, technology, and methodology related to the design and development of Conversational AI based solutions. Prepare and maintain communication materials like roadmaps, position papers, presentations, demos, playbooks and discuss the materials with business clients and partner IS services. Win What we expect of you We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The ground-breaking professional we seek is an Architect with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of Information Systems experience OR Master’s degree and 4 years of Information Systems experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of Information Systems experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of Information Systems experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Information Systems experience Preferred Qualifications: A developer at heart, with at least 8 years ability in application development Hands-on experience in architecting analytics and Conversational AI solutions and in managing delivery of IS projects Proficient coding capability in at least one of the major programming languages such as Python, R, Java. Solid foundation in natural language processing and machine learning Experience managing the end-to-end delivery of complex projects Experience with using cloud-based services AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Ability to communicate sophisticated quantitative analysis in a clear, detailed, and useful manner Attention to detail and ability to deal with ambiguity and change Good interpersonal skills Penchant to learn about new technology innovation and creativity in applying to business problems Thrive What you can expect of us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us. careers.amgen.com .

job_title: Sr Digital Marketing Data Analyst - Paid Social
job_Description: Title: Sr Digital Marketing Data Analyst - Paid Social  Location: Orlando, FL  Type: Direct Hire Rate: $70K + Full Benefits + Bonus Plan + Relocation (if needed)  Our TOP preference is to stay local within Central Florida but we will consider candidates out of state.  Description:  Sr. Digital marketing Data Analyst - Paid Social:  2-3 years’ experience managing paid social campaigns, including building, and launching ads, campaign analysis, and strategy  Experienced managing paid social campaigns in Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, and various other social media platforms.  Experience managing sizeable paid social budgets and supporting multiple clients/accounts preferred.  Strong reporting and MS Excel skills with strong analytical mindset.  Familiarity with Google AdWords, Adobe Analytics (formally Omniture), Google Search Console, and Google Analytics a plus.  Strong communicator who works well with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.  This is not an organic content focused position  Restaurant industry experience is a plus.  Bachelor’s degree required .   SR. DIGITAL MARKETING ANALYST - PAID SOCIAL  The Sr. Digital Marketing Analyst - Paid Social plays a key role working with internal and external partners including Brand Managers and Associate Brand Managers; the Specialty Restaurant (SR) Digital Team; Enterprise Digital Marketing (EDM), Web Analytics and Data Analysts; to execute Paid Social campaigns that drive profitable, incremental ROI. The individual in this role will serve as the primary contact for the brand(s) to assist with the planning and execution of Paid Social campaigns; ensures best practices are met in the day-to-day execution of the channel and coordinates Paid Social strategies across brands to leverage our scale, data, and insights for maximum efficiency in the restaurant category. This position collaborates with business partners to develop strategies on how to utilize Paid Social in conjunction with organic social, paid search, online video, and / or display / programmatic media; develops recommendations; and leverages members of the broader Marketing team to meet business objectives.   ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Develops and executes strategic initiatives for paid social media, in partnership with Enterprise Digital Marketing and brand teams to optimize presence in the Paid Social space.  Maintains and grows relationships with key digital partners with a special emphasis on Facebook/Instagram & Snapchat.  Performs and oversees regular Paid Social account audits, including audience targeting selection and analysis, ad creative and copy optimization, and competitor analysis, to establish consistent increases in Paid Social performance.  Partners with brand teams to establish KPI's for Paid Social.  Maintains and manages ongoing reports for Paid Social partners through dashboards and internal tracking tools to monitor impact of work and channel performance.  Assists in the development and evolution of channel and campaign reporting to provide cohesive and holistic insights to EDM and Brand teams.  Works with the company analytics team to ensure appropriate tracking and tagging is implemented for campaign activations.  Helps prioritize brand messaging to ensure business strategies are maintained and ladders up to campaign / business initiatives.  Produces clear and concise strategic recommendations for Brand, IT, and EDM teams from information garnered in competitor audits, campaign audits and reports, and through common industry tools.  Continuously monitors changes in the Paid Social ecosystem to provide recommendations and optimizations for relevant campaigns to EDM and Brand teams.  Partners with Organic and Paid Social Subject Matter Experts to communicate to brands any potential partnership opportunities, investment changes and key metrics of success.  REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS:  Individual should possess 3-5 years' relevant experience, particularly working in Paid Social, developing strategy and executing tactical campaigns, and performing analysis on performance in line with KPI's.  Experience in evaluating paid social media performance and providing data driven optimization recommendations.  Expertise in Microsoft Excel with a strong analytical mindset and appetite for data analysis and reporting development.  Knowledge of current digital consumer and industry behaviors trends, attitudes, preferences, and needs required.  Familiarity with Google AdWords, Facebook Ads, Adobe Analytics (formally Omniture), Google Search Console, and Google Analytics.  Ability to travel approximately 5% required.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.  REQUIRED EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a relevant field required.    OTHER KEY QUALIFICATIONS:  Detailed knowledge of Paid Social tools and experience managing large account structures and budgets.  Previous experience working on cross-functional teams.  Strong project management skills.  Demonstrated proficiency in organizing and planning work tasks.  Proven track record of results orientation.  Strong analytical skills, including the ability to assess data and draw key consumer, brand, and competitive insights.  Proven ability to work in a fast-paced team environment.  Ability to collaborate with a variety of different business partners, both internal and external.
