Description  Job Description: Leidos SDA has an immediate opening for a Principal Machine Learning Engineer. Driven by our talented workforce, the Security Detection and Automation Operation is the cornerstone of Leidos’ comprehensive suite of fully integrated security detection and automation solutions for aviation, ports and borders, and critical infrastructure customers around the world, with more than 24,000 products deployed across 120 countries. Leidos is positioned to address emerging and evolving threats through rapid development of innovative solutions for our global customers. Leidos keep our security customers at the leading edge of technology by designing, demonstrating, and deploying Machine Learning (ML) approaches to solve complex remote sensing problems. We are currently seeking a Machine Learning Research Scientist to work in our SDA operation. Emphasis is on research and development with activities ranging from support of early scientific research to transitioning products to production. The opportunity allows for independent work under the guidance of a multidisciplinary team and mentorship from our senior science and technology staff. As a ML scientist, you will apply your ML skills to a wide variety of problems and datasets, primarily focused on security scanning and sensing (chemical, RF, optical, X-ray, and other imaging) applications, including scene recognition and intelligence. Current projects include auto-detection and classification of chemical targets, and real-time scene modeling. You will bring experience, entrepreneurship, and creativity to our programs. You will interact with customers, lead technical projects, and spearhead growth in new areas. This is a fully remote position. The preference is for this candidate to be locale to Tewksbury MA, Vista CA, or St. Petersburg FL office locations.  Primary Responsibilities Work on and lead interdisciplinary teams to design, develop, and deploy ML algorithms for security scanning applications Participate in customer briefings Create new project ideas and brief those ideas internally to Leidos and externally to customers Basic Qualifications BS degree in a scientific field such as computer science, math, data science, physics, or engineering with 12 - 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience. May possess a Doctorate in technical domain. 5+ years of practical experience in applying ML to solve complex signal processing problems. Experience working and collaborating on multi-disciplinary teams, including leading technical teams and mentoring less experienced scientists Proficiency in signal processing algorithms, including time-frequency analysis and digital signal filtering Experience using Python, C++, and/or Matlab Preferred Qualifications PhD with prior relevant experience strongly preferred 10+ years of practical experience applying state-of-the-art ML techniques to signal processing and sensing applications Track record of research in ML technologies with high impact publications Strong fundamentals in problem solving and algorithm design Understands how to translate market requirements and mission needs to technology solutions sdas Pay Range: Pay Range $110,500.00 - $170,000.00 - $229,500.00 #Remote

job_title: Staff Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Engineer - Remote
job_Description: Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look. At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful. Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges. You will be a part of the Hematology Algorithms & Data Analytics team and report to the Director of Hematology, responsible for current on-market instrument support and new product advancements in the area of deep learning, ML, data algorithm development. If you thrive in a prototyping, collaborative role and want to work to build a world-class data analytics organization—read on! We are open to remote work from any continental U.S based major city with access to an international airport. In this role, you will have the following opportunities, but are not limited to:  Investigate, design, development of clustering and classification algorithms for blood cell identification and instrument reliability (predictive failures)  Algorithm prototyping and development using appropriate machine learning environment  Work with the AI Solutions Architect to drive innovation of new hematological parameters based on data pattern discoveries  Comply with the design and development process documentation as well as all the regulatory aspects of a medical software device  Interface with other functional development and customer support teams to contribute in all aspect of product improvement  Perform statistical analysis of experimental design aimed to improve instrument performance   The essential requirements of the job include: Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, statistical genetics, imaging science, computational biology, computer science, applied mathematics, applied physics or similar) or equivalent practical experience 5 years or more experienc Experience developing, training, evaluating, (and perhaps deploying) deep-learning models using popular machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow/Keras A firm understanding of deep neural network architectures such as CNNs and GANs Experience applying deep learning and computer vision techniques for image preprocessing, classification, object detection, segmentation, and feature extraction. Experience developing, training, and evaluating tradition machine algorithms such as PCA, SVM, Random Forests, and Gradient Boosting Well-versed in current deep learning literature and neural network optimization techniques such as batch norm, pruning, model quantization, residual/skip connections, inception modules, F1 and FID metrics etc. Familiar with NVIDIA deep learning ecosystem including CUDA, GPU compute as well as Jetson Nano and Quadro GPU hardware Technical writing of design documents It would be a plus if you also possess: Experience working with Docker containers and cloud-based compute environments; other tools: Git, Microsoft Azure, AWS Experience in hematology domain Beckman Coulter offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates’ and their families’ lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com. We believe you’ll like what you see! Beckman Coulter is a Danaher Operating Company. As a $20B company with 60,000 associates, ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and, during the past 25 years, DHR stock has outperformed the S&P 500 Index by more than 5,000 percent. The strength of our results is a testament to our teams and the power of the Danaher Business System. Our Purpose: “Helping Realize Life’s Potential” is what makes us excited to come to work each day! When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization. When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Our Opportunity:  Chewy's Supply Chain Team is seeking a  Technical Project Manager  to join the growing Supply Chain  Long Range Forecasting & Economic Research  team in Dania Beach, Florida. The Long Range Forecasting & Economic Research team is in charge of driving improvements in supply chain strategy through quantitative economics and scenarios analysis.  You will lead collaboration with business and technical teams of economists, data scientists and software engineers to deliver world-class solutions that are highly scalable and flexible. You will work with stakeholders and multiple business teams to identify, define, and specify solutions for forecasting needs. You will ensure all stakeholders are aware of successes, risks and project status. You will tailor your communications to specific audiences and communicate clearly and concisely to both business and technical audiences. You will also be responsible for managing all the required documentation related to forecasting and economic models.  In this role, you will be an integral part of a highly-autonomous team with the opportunity to directly influence feature roadmap, architecture and product adoption and scaling. This is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director of Forecasting.  What You’ll Do:   Execute and drive tech team program/project delivery, execution, and adoption across multiple organizations and teams  Lead project management of the development and implementation of forecasting and economic models as well as process enhancements using industry standard PM tools  Collaborate with project stakeholders in multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver on agreed upon milestones. Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs  Maintain the agile / sprint methodology for the developer teams  Execute on communications strategy to stakeholders including ownership of business cadence  Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities  Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner  Build and maintain integrated reporting for areas of responsibility  Coordinate team needs (team activities, event planning, etc.)  Own the business cadence and governance (weekly/monthly/quarterly business reviews) for area of responsibility  Build and manage project schedules/plans to support project delivery  Continuously monitor key metrics  Manage risk by bridging interdepartmental gaps  Monitor ingestion and acceptance of new tools / processes and improve deficiencies  Support the writing of documentation including model whitepapers, specifications, communication of research results  Position may require travel   What You’ll Need:   +3 years of relevant experience in technology companies or consulting services working directly with engineering teams  +2 years of technical program management experience including software and cloud-based development  Deep project management experiences in fast-moving business environments  Excellent interpersonal skill: ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities  Strong project management and writing skills as well as frontline readiness background  Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results: operational excellence mindset and data driven.  Exceptional communication (both written and verbal) skills; excellent at communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and ability to develop executive level messaging, report and presentations  BA/BS degree or equivalent with specialization in engineering, data science, marketing, finance, business, technology or related fields  Knowledge of project management tools such as Smartsheet, Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence)  Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules  Experience with enterprise-grade data analysis, visualization (eg., Tableau, Looker, etc.)  Knowledge of AWS big data platforms  Experience in leveraging Machine Learning (ML) technologies to inform business decisions  Startup mentality and growth mindset  Demonstrated ability to conceptualize, manage, and prioritize multiple projects  Demonstrated ability to program manage the design and deployment of complex, scalable services and/or customer experiences   Bonus  (if applicable):   PMP certified  Ability to analyze, consolidate, and aggregate data from various sources Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.   If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact  HR@chewy.com .   To access Chewy’s Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here:  https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy ).

job_title: AVP Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Technology & Digital
job_Description: Baptist Health South Florida is once again one of the 2020 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For! This is the 20th time Baptist Health has been recognized on the list. We have also been recognized for being among the best healthcare providers in the nation by U.S. News & World Reports in its 2020-2021 Best Hospitals and have been honored as one of PEOPLE's 2020 50 Companies that Care by PEOPLE magazine and Great Place to Work.  Baptist Health South Florida is the region's largest not-for-profit healthcare organization with more than 23,000 employees working across 11 hospital campuses and more than 100 outpatient facilities throughout Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward, and Palm Beach counties. In 2016 we welcomed the newest weapon in the fight against cancer, the world-class Miami Cancer Institute and proton therapy center.  Everything we do at Baptist Health, we do to the best of our ability. That includes supporting our team with extensive training programs, millions of dollars in tuition assistance, comprehensive benefits and more. Working within our award-winning culture means getting the respect and support you need to do your best work ever. Find out why this is the best place to be your best! Description: As an experienced leader in implementing AI/ML with a track record of success, you will grow an internal team positioned to have a great impact on the future of Healthcare. You will lead a global team that includes Data Scientists, AI Scientists, Software Engineers, and Product Managers in building our AI & other advanced analytics solutions. We are looking for a unique combination of skills: strong business acumen with a history of using data to solve business problems, deep analytical and data science skills, ability to drive and own business relationships, a strategic and technical mindset as well as the ability to lead and grow advanced data science and/or AI teams. A strong bias for patient, physician and other business outcomes is necessary along with an ability to make continuous improvements in application of AI/ML/Data techniques. Qualifications: MS Degree in Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline. PhD degree preferred.5+ years of senior leadership experience managing a team of AI/ML scientists & engineers who develop and deploy AI/ML models.15+ years of experience in Data Science/Analytics or related field. In-depth experience with modern AI & data science approaches, including unsupervised and supervised classification and regression algorithms such as k-means clustering, support vector machines, random forests, neural networks and deep learning. Experience with Deep Learning Frameworks such as Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch,Mxnet etc. Ability to apply these frameworks to real problems. Significant experience in the modeling of complex datasets in applied business applications. Advanced software development skills in standard data science languages (such as R, or Python) and familiarity with database systems (SQL, NoSQL, graph). In-depth experience of manipulating and analyzing large high dimensionality unstructured datasets, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders. Experience applying knowledge from multiple disciplines to identify and solve large and/or significantly complex problems that require scientific innovation. Experience and track record of successfully developing and delivering AI & Advanced analytics solutions using Public Cloud/AWS based Data/AI Technology platforms. Prior Experience leading teams that have developed and deployed ML models for classification, regression, and clustering with deep neural networks. Experience leading teams that use large scale data processing in AWS platforms. Experience with the Agile software development lifecycle methodologies (SAFe/Scrum). Experience building and managing large development teams; led them toward a big vision and consistent execution through mentoring, coaching, retrospectives, and feedback loop. Experience working with external Development & Integration partners and other vendors. Highly organized, detail-oriented approach to handling multiple projects under tight deadlines. Excellent interpersonal skills, technical leadership, project delivery, and people management.      EOE

Development Technology & Solutions is a partner of EA Studios. They span four continents, bringing together diverse individuals passionate about their craft from across the globe. They partner in every development phase while improving their expertise to create greater experiences for players. DTS participates in creating some of the most beloved games and supports ongoing live services. Through cutting-edge technology, data-driven insights, and state-of-the-art practices, they drive quality and directly impact players. They are a learning organization, sharing collaboratively and exploring innovative ways to solve challenges in creating amazing games for millions of players worldwide. We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to fill an exciting new role where you will help modernize game AI systems to improve gameplay and game validation for multiple platforms and multiple game engines using a variety of new machine learned AI and traditional AI approaches. Additionally, you will include the evaluation of proper machine learned techniques to apply to measuring and determining game health issues, such as, glitches, graphical or animation anomalies, audio issues and more. You will work on technical solutions that can be applied to multiple EA games and will work with multiple game team software engineers in graphics, animations, audio, and gameplay. You will report to the Technical Director.  Key Responsibilities: Implement advanced machine learning systems to provide automated game behavior measurement, validation, performance and functionality. Work with art, graphics and gameplay software engineers and with game quality assurance analysts to understand advanced gameplay mechanics and testing processing for future automation. Evaluate game code and architecture and recommend improvements. Provide training and initial support for the advanced systems that you implement. Be a communications bridge between engineering and data science teams. Remain flexible and perform a variety of tasks such as, scripting in and outside of game, in-game API creation, external tool creation, machine learning model prototyping, documentation and more. Required Technical Experience A bachelor's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent 5+ years experience in gameplay, AI engineering, online programming, embedded software, or related position 5+ years experience with C++, C# Knowledgeable with applied use of Machine Learning techniques for Computer Vision, Imitation/Reinforcement Learning, Audio Classification, and neural-network construction to solve non-research problems Familiar with multiple database platforms, application servers, and development environments Knowledge of game development or real-time embedded software applications Experience in game team development (Graphics, AI or Gameplay) Performance Competencies (Non-Technical Skills) Excellent verbal and written Experience working in a dynamic and collaborative interdisciplinary team environment Always innovate how to improve product quality and group productivity Excellent decision-making capabilities Quickly learn and apply new concepts, principles and solutions Demonstrate dependability and commitment to projects/tasks Analytical and problem-solving experience testing software

Duties and Responsibilities Manages datasets and ensures data quality (data cleaning); combines, organizes, and cleans data collected. Performs inferential analyses, including regression, ANOVA, factor analysis, IRT modeling, longitudinal data analysis, mixed modeling, and structural equation modeling. Performs descriptive analyses, such as means, variances, covariances/correlations, and frequencies. Summarizes statistical results by creating graphs, tables, and charts for presentation to leadership. Serves as technical resource for concept development by developing concept logic, testing and analyzing the results, and providing recommendations to improve the outcome. Identifies action from predictive and prescriptive results. Tracks trends in data and measures success of actions. Responsible for custom Suncoast Credit Union analytics, including the SunLogix, solution. This includes creating, maintaining, and troubleshooting models, lift charts, etc. Writes, reviews, and maintains documentation describing all elements of data warehouse and cube design (including standards, functionality, logic, deployment and implementation procedures, time estimates, and test plans). Maintains knowledge and understanding of current trends, laws, and issues affecting area of expertise. Attends educational events that will increase professional knowledge and be otherwise beneficial to the Credit Union. Completes annual BSA/AML Compliance Training and understands employee’s role in maintaining an effective BSA/AML compliance program, and completes FACT Act Red Flag training. Minimum Education, Experience, and Skill Requirements Bachelor’s degree in advanced Mathematics, Applied Statistics, Quantitative Measurement, or other quantitative analysis discipline. Master’s degree in one of these same fields preferred. 5 years progressively responsible experience in data analysis and data extraction, preferably with a financial institution. Experience working with MS Excel pivot tables, MS Access, SQL, SPS Statistics, or other statistical software. Able to prioritize tasks, deal effectively with competing and changing priorities, and meet deadlines. Accurate, detail-oriented, and organized. Able to analyze and resolve difficult and sometimes complex problems and situations. Strong knowledge and understanding of Credit Union products, services, policies, and procedures pertinent to the job. Strong knowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance necessary to successfully perform job responsibilities. Strong knowledge and understanding of all Credit Union computer systems and software applications required to perform job duties. Strong verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills in order to interact professionally and effectively with members, staff, vendors, and government regulators. Able to influence others regarding policies, practices, and procedures. Works independently with limited supervision. Technical Focus: Maintaining up-to-date knowledge within one's field of expertise; Applying technical skills and knowledge. Attention to Detail: Taking responsibility for a thorough and detailed method of working. Member Focus: Giving high priority to customer satisfaction and customer service; Anticipating member/business needs and acting accordingly. Self Management: Manages own time, priorities, and resources to achieve goals. Adaptability: Maintaining effectiveness in reaching set goals by adapting to changed circumstances, tasks, responsibilities, and people; adjusting one's own behavior in light of changing conditions. Communication: Shaping communication to the needs of the audience; conveying ideas and opinions clearly to others; listening attentively to others; using appropriate grammar and vocabulary. Conceptual Thinking: Understanding a given situation or problem by combining information that is readily available; identifying patterns or connections between situations that are not obviously related; identifying key or underlying issues in complex situations. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, employee is regularly required to sit, stand, and walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 pounds. Vision requirements include close and classroom vision. Periodically required to travel by automobile. Overnight travel periodically required. Periodically required to work other than normal business hours. Disclaimer Read Only Text This job description is not intended to be all inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the on-going needs of the Credit Union.

job_title: Director Data Scientist, Statistical and Risk Modeling
location: Suite 1700 100 North Tampa Street, Tampa, FL 33602
job_Description: You'll be an important part of our high-energy, unique, fast-paced, and innovative culture that delivers with the agility of a tech startup and the backing of a leading global consulting firm. In this particular role, you'll work specifically in the AI Analytics & Engineering Community within the Digital Lighthouse, on a wide range of projects. From applied AI to optimization to big data platform engineering, your analytical and technical skills will drive real impact in the business world. At KPMG, our commitment to your career development helps to set us apart as an employer. We want to enhance your potential, both for yourself and as a contributor to our firm. That's why we provide every opportunity to expand your skills, knowledge and experiences through formal education and training programs, leadership development opportunities, and, as well as informal one-on-one coaching and mentoring from your KPMG colleagues. KPMG is currently seeking a Director to join our KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics. Responsibilities: Translate advanced business analytics problems into technical approaches that yield actionable recommendations, in banking and financial services domain. Focus on leading model development and validation efforts relating to regulatory requirements (e.g. CCAR/DFAST, CECL, Initial Margin, etc.) and economic risk (e.g. PG/LGD, mortgage prepayment, pricing, xVA, customer segmentation, credit scorecard, etc.). Understand banking industry model governance requirements and procedures. Lead and evaluate model documentation, explainability, transparency, and maintainability. Lead workshops, innovation sessions with clients, multi-disciplinary, and cross-functional teams to identify business opportunities and artificial intelligence solutions utilizing processes and best practices to plan, lead, and execute delivery of machine learning engagements; Work with clients to manage risks, set expectations, and ensure successful delivery. Lead in a fast-paced and dynamic environment utilizing virtual and face-to-face interactions; manage complex work streams, expectations, project timelines and budgets, high quality written deliverables, and multiple responsibilities using structured approaches for operational excellence; Communicate results to executive level audiences. Work internally within KPMG’s other areas (Tax, Audit, and Advisory) to advance the client understanding of Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Statistical MOdeling; And with emerging technologies group within AI service providers (AWS, GCP and Azure) to provide a first-in-market solution approaches to complex business problems Deliver on engagement milestones by following analytics processes to mitigate risks in data, modeling, validation and delivery Work with clients to discover data sources and retrieve, prepare, and process a rich data variety of data sources such as social media, news, internal/external documents, emails, financial and operational data Qualifications: Minimum of ten years of experience leading teams of at least ten data scientists, statisticians, quantitative finance professionals, engineers, or other data & analytics professionals, including business development, requirements gathering, people development, and quality management. Graduate level degree from an accredited college/university in Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Finance, Applied Math, Engineering, or related fields; PhD is preferred. Ability to work with the business to understand goals and requirements. Create analytics-based solutions and an accompanying business case that meets the business objectives and business constraints; Ability to succinctly communicate technical concepts to business people and to articulate the business value of analytical findings and results, both in writing and verbally. Demonstrable industry experience performing data science from data discovery, cleaning, feature engineering, model selection, validation, interpretation, and deployment; Experience coding statistical methods following software development and data science best practices, and ability to restructure, refactor and optimize code for efficiency. Ability to perform code reviews and model reviews and to coach staff level team members to refine and improve their skills Ability to utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, such as R, Python, Spark, Hadoop and emerging Cloud Capabilities on Azure, GCP and/or AWS; experience with command-line scripting, data structures, and algorithms; Ability to work in a Linux environment Ability to travel when necessary; Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please. At KPMG any employee, partner or contractor must be fully vaccinated or have a reasonable accommodation for COVID-19 in order to go to any KPMG office, or to work on or in association with a federal contract (unless prohibited by applicable law).

The Decision Science team focuses on creating innovative mathematical models to inform business decision making through data. The team is interested in all fields related to data science, with emphasis on statistics, operations research, econometrics, and machine learning.  The Decision Science team resides within the Disney Decision Science + Integration (DDSI) organization. DDSI provides internal consulting services for clients across The Walt Disney Company. The DDSI team sits at the intersection of business strategy, advanced analytics, and technology integration to help our partners explore opportunities for analytics, shape business decisions, and drive value. Our work includes conceptualizing new solutions, solution design and development, implementation and integration with business processes, and ongoing business support.  The Senior Manager, Decision Science will lead a highly skilled team of experts across technical domains, in order to conceptualize, design, and develop new data and decision science capabilities, and on this basis to create reusable software and system components that have potential for broad use.   Responsibilities :  Manage direct reports, which may include managers as well as professional staff specializing in different technical disciplines. May also manage the work of further professional staff in a matrixed organization Lead a portfolio of complex projects and initiatives, to include responsibility for scope negotiation and work estimation, resource allocation, development and teaching of necessary skills, adaptation of plans to meet operational challenges, and representation of the team with senior leaders and with partners (e.g. product teams, client teams, and vendors) Lead research and development of emerging science, tools, and technologies Direct the design and development of analytics platform initiatives (e.g. science model capabilities such as Natural Language Processing or Causal Inference, or data engineering capabilities)  Basic Qualifications :  3 or more years of related/relevant experience Ability to understand and support multiple large business domains Competence in multiple topics from statistics, optimization, machine learning, and/or econometrics. Distinction in breadth of knowledge enabling responsibility for large, complex, or varied output Competence in mathematical computing with at least one programming language (e.g. Python, R, Java), and the ability to learn technical methods and tools independently  Preferred Qualifications:  Proven knowledge of revenue management context, including demand forecasting, resource allocation, and pricing Familiarity with software development tools such as GitLab/GitHub, Docker, and cloud computing tools such as AWS  Required Education :  Master's or Ph.D. in technical discipline (Statistics, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Econometrics, or related field) or equivalent experience

As the leading Spanish-language media and content company in the U.S., Univision entertains, informs, and empowers US Hispanics with news, sports, and entertainment across broadcast & cable television, audio, digital and streaming platforms. The proposed Televisa-Univision merger will broaden our global Spanish-language media footprint with the largest library of owned Spanish-language content and unmatched production capabilities to power its preeminent television, digital and streaming platforms. The newly created Enterprise Data Science team will serve as the data science hub for the organization, providing access and insights to our business leaders as they both develop new services and optimize existing services. This team is responsible for building and enhancing large-scale and high-performance systems to organize and store data from multiple platforms and conducting advanced statistical analyses to help optimize the experience for our audience. This team also develops key data assets for the company, including our Hispanic HH Graph, proprietary customer segments and our data-driven video ad network, and manages relationships with key partners to improve UCI data assets and enable new data-driven services. Position Summary The Data Scientist will be responsible for developing statistical, machine learning, and optimization models, validating new 1st and 3rd party data sources, and build out both internal and customer-facing data-driven applications. They will also be responsible for maintaining and building out relevant product analytics, metrics, and experimentation and measurement frameworks. This role reports into the Director, Data Science. A successful candidate will be an integral member of the Enterprise Data Science team and a key partner for senior analysts across the business. This person will also work closely with colleagues across the wider data strategy organization to develop proprietary data assets and with our platform teams to develop new services and optimize existing services. Job Responsibilities Execute deep-dive analyses that are priorities of the business Facilitate data-driven and informed decision making and prioritization Develop strong cross-functional partnerships across Univision to drive team success Make data science accessible and applicable for all businesses on our platform Explore new metrics that provide business value with accuracy and stability Required Skills & Experience Minimum 1 year of experience as a data scientist Demonstrated use and understanding of statistical analysis Proficiency in Python Proficiency in SQL Bachelor’s degree in a broadly quantitative field Experience conducting analyses to drive business impact Experience communicating effectively with business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders of different disciplines Desired Skills & Experience Advanced (M.S./Ph.D.) degree in a broadly quantitative field Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Spark/Big Query/Snowflake) Ability to thrive in a high pressure and rapidly changing, less structured environment Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, and maintain focus and confidentiality Strong relationship building ability Excellent written and verbal communication skills Full professional proficiency in English and either professional Spanish proficiency or the desire to become proficient in Spanish Has knowledge of and actively consumes Univision content is a plus! Eligibility Requirements Employment/education will be verified Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis Univision requires that all U.S. and Puerto Rico employees be vaccinated against COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to submit proof of vaccination. The Company is an equal opportunity employer, and will reasonably accommodate a qualified candidate, who may be unable to be vaccinated, consistent with federal, state, and local law. Univision is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Senior Manager - Machine Learning Product Manager
job_Description: When you join Verizon  Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing...  As the leader of the Machine Learning (ML) Product Manager team within the Platforms and Ecosystems (P&E) organization, you will lead a team of 5+ accomplished professionals with a demonstrated track record of success. You will act as a mentor, coach, and provide oversight to the team, nurturing their development and clearing hurdles they encounter. You will need to establish relationships with key stakeholders to ensure open communication and collaboration is never stifled. The team works within the NBx Decisioning ecosystem to manage the delivery of probabilistic assets that predict, prescribe, and optimize the experiences being served to customers. Act as consultants to experience owners to determine their needs, and whether those needs are a fit for an ML-driven solution. If they are, they provide their expertise to guide the design of the end user solution to best fit an ML-driven product. Once the end user solution is defined, they collaborate with the Data Science and ML Engineering teams as they deliver the ML product, and ensure the product that is delivered meets the needs of the end user solution. Finally, they help analyze and monitor the performance of the model and end user solution, iterating on the ML product as necessary to optimize performance. What we’re looking for...  You’re a leader and have demonstrated your leadership ability as a team leader or by taking leadership roles with peers. You have experience creating a vision and strategy, then driving that to reality. You know how to influence up, down, and across groups, and you take satisfaction in mentoring others. You understand Machine Learning concepts and how they can be applied to provide the best experiences for customers. You know what it takes to move work forward, anticipating hurdles and overcoming them. You believe that collaboration and teamwork leads to the best results, and you know how to work as part of a team. You’ll need to have: This hybrid role will have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days as set by the manager. Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Working knowledge of Machine Learning and Data Science principles. Experience delivering software products, either as a product owner, product manager, or engineer. Willingness to travel. Even better if you have: Experience leading a team of professionals. Degree in mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, computer science, or economics. ML or Pega certifications Experience with building machine learning models. Experience with probabilistic optimization and analytics. Experience managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders. Working knowledge of PEGA CDH. Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our  diversity and inclusion  page to learn more.  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement Verizon requires new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Verizon provides reasonable accommodations consistent with legal requirements (e.g., for medical or religious reasons).

Our Purpose We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results. Job Title Manager - Data Engineering & Analytics As a Data Scientist Engineer Leader, you will develop data & analytics solutions that sit atop vast datasets gathered by retail stores, restaurants, banks, and other consumer-focused companies. The challenge will be to create high-performance algorithms, cutting-edge analytical techniques including machine learning and artificial intelligence, and intuitive workflows that allow our users to derive insights from big data that in turn drive their businesses. You will have the opportunity to create high performance analytic solutions based on data sets measured in the billions of transactions and front-end visualizations to unleash the value of big data.  You will have the opportunity to develop data-driven innovative analytical solutions and identifying opportunities to support business and client needs in a quantitative manner and facilitate informed recommendations / decisions through activities like building ML models, automated data pipelines, design data architecture/schema, perform jobs in big data cluster by using different execution engines and program languages such as Hive/Impala, Python, Spark, R, etc.  Your Role  Drive the evolution of Data & Services products/platform with an impact focused on data science and engineering Participate in development of data and analytic infrastructure for product development Participate in identification and evaluation of data elements to deliver analytics for product development Prototype new algorithms, experiment, evaluate and deliver actionable insights. Continuously innovate and determine new approaches, tools, techniques & technologies to solve business problems and generate business insights & recommendations Partner with roles across the organization including consultants, engineering, and sales to determine the highest priority problems to solve Evaluate trade-offs between many possible analytics solutions to a problem, taking into account usability, technical feasibility, timelines, and differing stakeholder opinions to make a decision Break large solutions into smaller, releasable milestones to collect data and feedback from product managers, clients and other stakeholders Evangelize releases to users, incorporating feedback, and tracking usage to inform future development Ensure proper data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating Data Lineage, Quality checks, classification, etc. Work with small, cross-functional teams to define vision, establish team culture and processes Consistently focus on key drivers of organization value and prioritize operational activities accordingly Identify and act upon product improvement opportunities Aggregate and collate client data sets and conduct data manipulation and technical analysis leveraging industry techniques and best practices to identify trends and draw insights Clean and structure data sets fed to downstream analytics Escalate technical errors or bugs detected in project work Maintain awareness of relevant technical and product trends through self-learning/study, training classes and job shadowing. Ideal Candidate Qualifications:   Superior academic record at a leading national university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics or Technology related field or equivalent work experience At least 5 years of experience as data engineer and with open-source tools Prior experience in working in product development/management role In depth technical knowledge, drive and ability to learn new technologies Outstanding communication skills (both verbal and written) and organizational skills Strong project management skills Strong hands-on experience in Analytics & Computer Science Demonstrated basic knowledge of statistical analytical techniques, coding, and data engineering Experience leveraging open source tools, predictive analytics, machine learning, Advanced Statistics, and other data techniques to perform basic analyses High proficiency in using Python/Scala, Spark, Hadoop platforms & tools (Hive, Impala, Airflow, NiFi, Scoop), SQL to build Big Data products & platforms Experience in building and deploying production level data driven applications and data processing workflows/pipelines and/or implementing machine learning systems at scale in Java, Scala, or Python and deliver analytics involving all phases like data ingestion, feature engineering, modeling, tuning, evaluating, monitoring, and presenting Curiosity, creativity, and excitement for technology and innovation Demonstrated quantitative and problem-solving abilities Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail Motivation, flexibility, self-direction, and desire to thrive on small project teams The following skills will be considered as a plus  Financial Institution or a Payments experience a plus Experience in developing integrated cloud applications with services like Azure. Databricks, Amazon or GCP Experience of managing/working in Agile teams Expertise with tunning Impala and Spark jobs in Hadoop Experience developing and configuring dashboards Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. job_title: Sr. Data Scientist - Consumer Insights & Analytics
job_Description: The Opportunity As a thought leader, the Sr. Data Scientist takes an active role in advancing the Data Science practice at Qurate, not only by executing some of the most complex and high-priority modeling and measurement projects, but also by proactively identifying and building support for projects and capabilities that will provide the greatest business impact. In this role you will be expected to own advanced models from end to end, and make project and strategy recommendations by synthesizing a deep understanding of business functions and systems with an up-to-date understanding of what is possible in advanced analytics.   Who We Are  The Data Science team within the Consumer Insights & Analytics organization plays a primary role in answering business-critical questions of causal measurement, prediction, and optimization. Our work is mainly project-based and supports a wide variety of business functions, including marketing, ecommerce, broadcast, product, and operations. Example projects include marketing mix optimization, airtime optimization, price elasticity estimation, and personalization, recommendation, and targeting models.   Your Impact Construct analytic data sets for exploration, modeling, insight generation   Develop accurate models for forecasting and inference   Develop test designs, hypotheses, success metrics, and test requirements, and execute test analysis   Conduct in-depth data analysis, data and prepare visualizations summarizing key features of the data   Identify new opportunities to add business value through advanced analytics   Work with stakeholders to define business questions and success criteria   Collaborate on long-term, cross-functional projects (project management)   Research best practices, technologies, tools, and trends; conduct change management for new methodologies   Develop novel techniques or maintain legacy code when needed   What You Bring Advanced degree (Master’s/PhD) in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative discipline   5+ years’ experience in statistical programming in Python, SAS or R,data integration with SQL   2+ years in practical machine learning using frameworks such as scikit-learn, H2O, TensorFlow, Caffe, Mllib   Demonstrated expertise in parallelized programming via Spark, Hadoop, etc.   Experience with Microsoft Azure, Google BigQuery and/or AWS cloud platforms. Familiarity with Azure and Databricks ideal   Experience in data visualization and exploration tools (Tableau preferred)   Experience at a B2C e-commerce company a plus   Demonstrated history of identifying, executing and securing adoption of advanced analytics projects   Experience leading or representing analytics teams on ongoing cross-functional projects   Expertise in various statistical methodologies such as regression analysis, cluster analysis, decision trees, factor analysis/principal component analysis, time series, survival models, neural networks   Disposition to simplify: streamline work processes, simply communicate complex statistical concepts   #LI-RB1

Strong SQL & Excel skills are needed for this position. Willing to train in Supply Chain Management Overview  The Supplier Analyst will serve as the primary vendor contact to market, manage, and advance proprietary sales data tools. This role will provide training, insight assessment, and analytical support to help suppliers maximize the use of the tool and achieve their sales goals. create and update training module and materials Set up access for new supplier users on their desktops, laptops, tablets, and smartphones Manage all supplier correspondence; communicate with suppliers regarding system updates and expiring subscriptions Maintain active supplier subscription, license, and annual billing information Evaluate and recommend new database tools and processes to lead to increased supplier interests Develop new analytical processes to preserve a competitive advantage over third-party vendors Analyze market data and draft a quarterly State of the Industry report to send to suppliers Actively market the process to new suppliers for program expansion Develop market research, data analysis, and interpretation of market measures for use in supplier presentations Collaborate with Trade Development Team to develop strategic data modeling tools and databases Perform other job-related duties as assigned Additional Primary Responsibilities  Minimum Qualifications  A Bachelor s degree plus three years of experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience Physical Demands  Physical demands include a considerable amount of time sitting and typing/keyboarding, using a computer (e.g., keyboard, mouse, and monitor), or adding machine Physical demands with activity or condition may occasionally include walking, bending, reaching, standing, squatting, and stooping May require occasional lifting/lowering, pushing, carrying, or pulling up to 20lbs  Southern Glazer’s Wine and Spirits provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Deep Learning Expert   Work you'll do   The Deep Learning Expert will support pursuits as part of a specialized pre-sales team focusing strictly on the latest Machine Learning tool and apply deep learning models to a wide range of problems. The DL expert will be responsible for working with other data scientists, solutions architects, front-end and back developers as well as business-oriented pursuit teams to design and build technical solutions. These will often be in the form of prototypes and dashboards to prove out a concept.  The DL expert is expected to advice specifically in the area of deep learning, develop AI solutions and guide more junior data scientists. This will include technical and non-technical advice across the entire pre-sales development lifecycle and may include working with the post-sales delivery team which will be taking the prototype to production. The Deep Learning Expert is expected to design solutions, conduct code reviews and optimize computations by leveraging superclusters and GPU computations.   The team   The machine learning group sits in the Deloitte Platform (DP) practice, part of Deloitte Consulting LLP, which supports the firm on a technical level to offer a variety of mixed services to provide the clients' needs. The machine learning team specifically focusses on creating products and solutions that require deeper analytical and problem-solving skills to create tangible results. This is a continuous cycle where we strive to keep innovating and provide state-of-the-art assets.   Qualifications   Required  Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related field and 4+ years of industry experience Working experience with tools such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, MxNet or other deep learning libraries. Proven python skills Design and refinement of deep learning algorithms through all layers of an application such as frontend, integration, application, and business logic. Dependency management as well as source code control such as Git Experience developing in cloud-based applications (AWS, GCP, Azure) Working experience in performance tuning of end-to-end (E2E) service APIs  Preferred  Other language expertise like R, C++, Scala is a plus. Experience with GPU-based training and optimization is considered a plus. Familiarity with ML operations services such as SageMaker or other industry standards. Solid understanding of best practices such as test-driven development and industry established code quality standards Strong team player used to work in an agile (scrum) environment with tools like Jira Strong communicator - ability to adapt verbal, written communication to audience Familiarity with security best practices #SNET22  #NBI22

AECOM is actively seeking a self-motivated technology minded data science specialist for immediate employment in the Fort Lauderdale, Florida office to support and expand digital services machine learning, predictive modeling, and data analytics. The Data Science Specialist will report to the Data Science & Analytics Manager in the Technology Service Department and support both internal and external clients across multiple business lines This position will support a wide variety of projects including environmental permitting, construction, site assessments/inspections, energy infrastructure, water resources, transportation, and more. The selected candidate will perform high level data analysis tasks, leverage statistical and machine learning models for forecasting, organize data and visualizations into dashboards, and generate reports to solve interesting and complex business problems for AECOM clients. The candidate will work both independently and as part of a collaborative team to conduct data analysis, model data products, and create custom analytical tools designed to support business decision workflows. The position also requires proposing and initiating new and innovative approaches using data analytics and helping promote those services to internal and external clients. An ideal candidate will demonstrate strong technical skills, high degree of technical savvy, ability to learn and adopt new technologies and strong desire to apply innovative technology to meet project demands. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential. At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world. We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world. Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business. We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career. When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started. The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to: + Provide innovative digital solutions using predictive learning and machine learning + Work under general supervision to develop end-to-end data science solutions through tasks including data wrangling, exploratory analysis, transformations, dimensionality reduction, assessments, visualizations, and similar tasks + Develop innovative solutions that leverage data science to improve business workflows/deliverables and allow for data-driven decision-making + Communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner using storytelling / visualization + Stay on the forefront of novel data sciences tools, solutions, and concepts in the machine learning space + Generate technical documentation describing developed data science solutions and training staff to employ those solutions + Ability to work with both non-geospatial and geospatial data Minimum Requirements + Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics or related field and six (6) years of progressive data science experience with Applied AI, Machine Learning, statistics, modeling and/or related fields + Working knowledge of Python, R, SQL and/or related languages Preferred Qualifications + Graduate or Postgraduate degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field + Strong working knowledge of Python, R, and SQL + Experience building classification and regression models including machine learning models + Understanding of Applied Statistics (e.g., Regression Analysis, Stochastic Processes, Bayesian Analysis, and Multivariate Analysis, etc.) + Comfortable working with Microsoft Office, ESRI Software Suite, Power BI, Tableau and common statistical modeling applications + Familiar with cloud computing tools such as Amazon web services, Snowflake, and/or Sagemaker + Familiarity with Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) (e.g., real time traffic monitoring systems – vehicle counting, density estimation via traffic cameras, speed estimation, etc.)  Additional Information: + Relocation is not offered for this position What We Offer When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Our Cloud First multi-service group of more than 70,000 cloud professionals delivers a full stack of integrated cloud capabilities like data, edge, integrated infrastructure and applications, deep ecosystem skills, culture of change along with pre-configured industry solutions to shape, move, build and operate our clients’ businesses in the cloud.
